quotes: Pinochet did not run for the presidency in 1989 as he previously promised.
On 11 December 1989, the day of the elections, he obtained the district's second majority.
In 1990, Lagos was named Minister of Education by President Patricio Aylwin.
In June 1993, he pushed for the notion of using primary elections in order to select the Concertación coalition's candidate for the following presidential election.
In 1994, Frei himself named Lagos Minister of Public Works.
In 1999, Lagos resigned as minister in order to begin his presidential campaign.
In the first round of the presidential election in December of the same year, he defeated right-wing candidate Joaquín Lavín, by only 30,000 votes.
